meanings.definition: To hold or grasp with the hand in an upward position.
meanings.sent2: Please uphand the book and pass it to me.
meanings.sent3: He uphands the cookie jar to keep it away from the kids.
meanings.sent4: The magician uphands the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent5: The teacher uphands the globe to show the class where we live.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift up with the hand.
meanings.sent1: He uphands the flag during the national anthem.
meanings.sent2: Can you uphand the box onto the shelf for me?
meanings.sent3: The toddler uphands his toy truck in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter uphands the child from the burning building.
meanings.sent5: She uphands the trophy in victory after the race.

meanings.definition: Positioned with the hand facing upward.
meanings.sent1: The uphand bowl was perfect for holding the soup.
meanings.sent2: She placed the coins in the uphand position on the table.
meanings.sent3: The uphand cup kept the drink from spilling.
meanings.sent4: The uphand palm caught the falling leaves gently.
meanings.sent5: The uphand basket was ideal for collecting fruits from the tree.
